newsitem.title: USA: Eagle River to divest non-IT units.
newsitem.headline: Eagle River to divest non-IT units.

text.p: Eagle River Interactive said on Tuesday it will divest all its units that are not related to information technology training.
Eagle River said in a news release that it is negotiating to sell its interactive development business to Omnicom Group Inc.
The company also said it is negotiating to sell the assets of SkiView Inc, its outdoor advertising subisidiary, to an unnamed investor group.
Eagle River's Interactive Development Group had revenues of $14.3 million in 1996, while SkiView had revenues of $3.9 million.

Eagle River also said it relocated its headquarters from Avon, Colo., to Scottsdale to focus on its IT training business. Mastering Computers, Eagle River's training subsidiary, is based in Scottsdale.
Eagle River shares closed down 1/16 to 9-9/16 in Nasdaq trading. Their year low was 5, while the high was 17-1/4.
